page.title: 12Witherley Playing Field
page.content:
Witherley Playing Field was opened in 1955 as a memorial to those men from the village who served and died in the Second World War. It was opened by Mr D R Stokes, Chairman of the Market Bosworth Rural District Council. It was developed on what used to be pasture land owned by the church.
There is a Playing Field Committee, who raise money to keep the field in good order, organising events such as a New Year's Eve dance, and a "Field Day" which comprises games and sports, with stalls, raffles and bingo.
People are asked not to take dogs on to the field, and to take care that no-one is put in danger if they are playing with a hard ball.
